# Basics Tips on Vs Code

***Nice workshop about vs code features and how to optimize your workflow with a bunch of tools that vs code provide for us.***

[Burke Holland course github](https://burkeholland.gitbook.io/vs-code-can-do-that/)
[Vs Code refactoring docs](https://code.visualstudio.com/docs/editor/refactoring)

**Basic command:**
`CTRL P`
`CTRL SHIFT P`
**Escaping:**
`ESC`
*removing `>`* will open the file search mode as `CTRL P`
**Accessing setting json file:**
`Preferences: Open Settings(JSON)`
**The Emoji Windows Menu:**
Window + `;`
**To recall autocomplete helper:**
`CTRL + SPACE`
**To fold an html tag**, like an ugly SVG taking so much place in the code:
`CTRL SHIFT P` + `Fold`
it will keep it fold even you reload the file.

**Toggling inside VS Code** :
`CTRL 1` to get the cursor on the code section
`CTRL 0` to get the cursor on the sidebar
on the sidebar `ENTER` to open a file (windows)
hit `f2` on the selected file to rename it
or hit `CTRL A` to select all files in the current directory
`CTRL J` to get the terminal

**NOTES:** `CTRL ~` to get the cursor on the terminal section!??

<br>
<br>
<br>

## 1.Plugins & Extensions

- peacock
- bracket pair colorizer
- toggle format on save or Formatting Toggle
- image preview
- version lens (npm & package.json)
- Simple React Snippets
- NativeScript to help debugging mobile apps as well 

### Plugins details

#### Emmet

- launch two or more sections `()+()` or `^`
- can add multiple css classes: `.container.colum.col-1.is-large`
- hit `CTRL SPACE` to make a sort of refresh if it loose emmet, then it comes back

- `Balance (inward) | (outward)`, select the next html element wrapping (inward)...
- `Wrap With Abbreviation`, insert content in a html element
- `Update Tag`, to switch a html tag to another
- emmet `Update Image Size`

#### Formatting document

`CTRL SHIFT P` then `Format Document`

***Formatting Toggle***: use extensions as Toggle Format on save or Formatting Toggle
To turn off, access the settings json file then turn off to `false`

#### Version Lens

- On package.json it will check all dependencies telling us if its the latest version or not...
- on package.json: enter a dependency (if needed `CTRL + SPACE`) hit `ENTER` it will autocomplete
or in the value it will loads all the latest versions

<br>
<br>
<br>

## 2.Moving & Selecting

`ALT SHIFT+ ⬆ / ⬇` : will duplicate
`CTRL SHIFT K` (or X): will delete line, X will cut
`CTRL SHIFT + ⬅|➡`to select word by word
`CTRL + ⬅|➡`to move in a line word by word
`CTRL + ⬆|⬇` to move Up / Down 

### Code Folding or Hiding a section

`CTRL SHIFT )`  ||  `CTRL SHIFT P` + "**Fold**" to Fold a specific block code
`CTRL SHIFT ^`  ||  `CTRL SHIFT P` + "**Unfold**"

**To specify our own region to hide**
*use the syntax in a comment in js or html*

```javascript
//#region hidden section
... here the code to hide
//#endregion hidden section 
```

```html
<!--#region html hidden section --->
<!--#endregion html hidden section --->
```

<br>
<br>
<br>

## 3.Multiple Elements

### Selecting elements

Hit the `>` arrow to toggle the replace menu on the search bar.

`CTRL D` to select multiples elements
`CTRL K` to skip the next elements and keep continuing selecting
then `CTRL D` ...

### Find & Replace

`CTRL F` to find ***on a file*** an instance
`CTRL SHIFT F` will attempt to find the instance ***on the entire project***

**More advanced**
*How to use Regular expression with a common syntax..*

1. `CTRL SHIFT F` then clicking the `.*` button
2. then define for example trying to find all images...
3. hit `jpeg|png|jpg`
4. `ALT ENTER`
5. then `CTRL` + ⬅ (in this case)
6. change the images path
